contentrichtext.text: {{confuse|Legality Movement}} {{Infobox Political Party |country = Albania |party_logo = [[File:Partia Lëvizja e Legalitetit.jpg|200px]] |name_english = Legality Movement Party |name_native = Partia Lëvizja e Legalitetit |colorcode = Yellow Red Black |leader = [[Eqerem Spahia]] |foundation =1924 |ideology = [[Social conservatism]] <br> [[Monarchism]] |position = [[Right-wing]] |colorcode = {{Legality Movement Party/meta/color}} |international = [[International Monarchist Conference]] |european = |europarl = |colours = [[Yellow]], [[Red]] [[Black]] |headquarters = [[Tirana]] |website = http://www.legaliteti.org/ }} {{Politics of Albania}} The '''Legality Movement Party''' (LMP) ({{Lang-sq|Partia Lëvizja e Legalitetit}} or {{Lang|sq|''PLL''}}) is a right-wing [[monarchist]] political party in [[Albania]],<ref name=cas>{{cite journal|last=Mudde|first=Cas|title=Extreme-right Parties in Eastern Europe|journal=Patterns of Prejudice|year=2000|volume=34|issue=1|pages=5–27|url=http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/00313220008559132|accessdate=7 September 2012}}</ref> led by [[Eqerem Spahia]].<ref>[http://www.gazetatema.net/web/?p=13636 Ja partitë politike me emra të çuditshëm, 114 regjistrime ne Gjykatë] Tema online</ref> It supported the return to power of the House of [[Zogu]] under [[Leka Zogu|Crown Prince Leka of the Albanians]]. In the 2001 [[election]]s it was part of the [[Union for Victory]] (''Bashkimi për Fitoren'') coalition which received 37.1% of the vote and 46 members of parliament. PLL is member of the International Monarchist Conference. ==See also== * [[Legality Movement]] * [[Zog of Albania]] * [[Leka, Crown Prince of Albania]] * [[Prince Leka of Albania]] * [[Eqerem Spahia]] * [[Skënder Zogu]] ==References== <references/> ==External links== *[http://www.legaliteti.org Official website] [[Category:Political parties in Albania]] [[Category:Conservative parties in Albania]] [[Category:Monarchist parties]] {{Albania-party-stub}}
